en.resources:
* Hayes SC, Pistorello J, Levin ME. [Acceptance and commitment therapy as a unified model of behavior change](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/0011000012460836). The Counseling Psychologist. 2012;40(7).

* Villatte JL, Vilardaga R, Villatte M, Plumb Vilardaga JC, Atkins DC, Hayes SC. [Acceptance and Commitment Therapy modules: Differential impact on treatment processes and outcomes](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4752868/). Behav Res Ther. 2016;77.

* Rickardsson, J, Gentili, C, Holmström, L, et al. (2021). [Internet-delivered acceptance and commitment therapy as microlearning for chronic pain: A randomized controlled trial with 1-year follow-up](https://doi.org/10.1002/ejp.1723). European Journal of Pain vol 25.
en.name: Coping with Crisis
en.intro: Are you in a tough spot fearing what the future might hold? This course will give you tools for coping better with change. You’ll learn a range of psychological tools that are proven to reduce the effects of overwhelm, anxiety and stress.
en.description:
## About this course

You are not alone. Sometimes we find ourselves in situations we never expected.

When we’re faced with a challenge, it’s perfectly normal to experience strong emotions such as stress, worry and anxiety. Experiencing difficult emotions can propel us into constructive action. But often we get stuck in our anxiety and engage in behaviors that make us feel worse instead.

In this course, you’ll learn a range of psychological tools that are proven to reduce the effects of overwhelm, anxiety and stress.

## What will I learn?

- Increase your ability to handle challenges
- Practice to meet the situation as it is
- Face difficult emotions and experiences

## How does it work?

- This course consists of 3 lessons.
- By doing this course together with a group of friends, colleagues or other people in the 29k app, you gain more value from the course, and get support along the journey.
- After completing each lesson, you can have a sharing session with your group to dive deeper into each topic. This is an opportunity to be present, learn from each other, and create a safe space for meaningful human connection.

#### Who created this course?

The course was crafted by the psychologists at 29k in collaboration with teachers and researchers from the university Karolinska Institute in Stockholm, Sweden.

#### About 29k

29k is a Swedish foundation and one of the initiating partners of the IDGs initiative. 29k's mission is to democratize access to inner development. 29k does this via a non-profit, open-source digital platform that provides free access to evidence-based psychological tools for mental health and inner development. All interventions are co-created together with leading researchers on the topic in question. Check out more at [www.29k.org](https://29k.org).
